website_summaries.verdict: This is sound choice if you want a compact design with easy setup.
pros: Has WiFi and mobile capabilities and a smaller design than costlier models on our list
Can be installed in just a few minutes

website_summaries.verdict: This low-priced all-in-one printer features scanning, copying, and faxing.
pros: The small footprint of this printer and its optional quiet mode make it a great little printer for a dorm room
It is compatible with Windows and Mac, and it boasts an impressive speed of 20 pages per minute
Customers love the quick and intuitive setup
cons: The instant ink subscription program is a good idea that many customers found somewhat unreliable

customer_reviews.title: if you don't want the instant ink program, don't used enclosed ink cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Comes with hp's instant ink-ready ink cartridges, which cannot be used without signing up for the instant ink program. In order to use the printer without using the instant ink program, you must buy other ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Mommalotamus

customer_reviews.title: We have had it less than a month and it ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had it less than a month and it is having problems. Says paper jam when there is not one, low ink and all ink is new, and it makes a loud noise.. We got a replacement and it quit working right again. Less then a month!
customer_reviews.author: donna whitehead

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT AT ALL COSTS!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This printer is the biggest piece of crap I have ever owned. It consistently disconnects from WiFi (you have to restart the printer EVERY time you want to print something new.) Constant paper jams. Ink cartridge jams. It's like having a drunk uncle who SOMETIMES likes to print. AVOID THIS PRODUCT AT ALL COSTS! It works great when it wants to. Constantly disconnects from Wi-Fi, despite using ALL of the manufacturer's recommendations of setting up it's own Wi-Fi Connection. If you like having to restart your printer every time you want to print something, then this is the product for you. If not, buy something else as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Constantly reinstalling this piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: About 2 months after buying this, I had to reinstall the software completely to get it to work. It went downhill from there. I've had to reinstall the software every week and the CD no longer works. I would NOT recommend this printer/scanner to anyone. It also has difficulty keeping scanner settings. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the problems
customer_reviews.text: Broke down, ink cartridges cost as much as new printer and still not working. Apparently HP Printer's have notified COSTCO of ink cartridge issues, but have not bothered to notify those who purchase their printer's. HP used to be the 'go to' for best office equipment, quality and service is lacking. I need a business computer I can count on, this isn't it if does not acknowledge a new ink cartridge, and malware is up to date, I did check.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: No computer, no home network? No problem!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my Mother-In-Law for use with her iPad. She doesn't have a computer or a Wi-Fi network, so we wanted to surprise her with something which was easy to use and simple to setup. We couldn't be more please. It worked nearly right out of the box, and her iPad 3 connected and printed immediately every time. It prints quickly and quietly, too.
customer_reviews.author: J. PalmerTop Contributor: Astronomy

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Enroll in Instant Ink
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer thinking that it would be great. It does not work since I enrolled in Instant Ink. If you ever cancel, they remotely shut down the ink cartridges (WHICH YOU PAID FOR WHILE ON THE PLAN) and your printer will no longer print anything until you go to the store and buy new cartridges, even if the ones you purchased through their plan are still completely full. If you contact them for help, they will simply force you to enroll in a new plan.
customer_reviews.author: NNNMMMM

customer_reviews.title: I work in the IT field and I've sworn at it twice this week
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job printing when it wants to. Sometimes stuff is printed before I can walk to it and sometimes it prints out ten minutes later. It's fallen off the stable 100mbps network twice this week, sometimes will print half a page, but over the past two weeks it's eventually printed everything I've needed it to. Not recommended for grandparents or non tech savvy, but if you know what you're doing and can troubleshoot quickly it's good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer W.

customer_reviews.title: Overly complicated set up; subscription service a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: For the price I can't complain too much about this printer. There are a couple of issues though. One is that it doesn't connect to a wireless 5G network which is really lame. The other is that there are too many steps to the set up and like so many computer/software manufacturers today they try to hijack your computer with all their required software. I'm really confused about the printing subscription too. I feel I should be able to print as many pages per month as the ink allows and not have to pay a monthly subscription to print a limited number of pages. I really don't understand that. More BS from the tech industry.
customer_reviews.author: Grilled Sardine

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Issues
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this printer, it seemed to be a dream at first but within a few days the screen went black and the only way to get it to come back on was by unplugging it and plugging it back in. I couldn’t get it to print a picture in color on photo paper no matter what I did. It then started having issues when I would try to change the preferences and would cause an error and whatever program I was trying to print from would shut down. I ended up returning it for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarena

customer_reviews.title: Basic combo printer
customer_reviews.text: Simple combo printer, gets the job done. What the pictures don't show is that the paper tray is on the back and sticks straight up so that when you load the paper it's sticking out above the top of the printer (not a big deal unless you are working with a limited amount of space). Overall it does what it's supposed to do, without any frills. Simple to scan, fax, and print. Print quality is fine, and it was relatively easy to set up right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Scan and print ok, copies way too slow
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for a few months now, only 2-3 week do I print something. Not much use. I used to love it, but suddenly the copies are taking aprox 3 minutes to print. As a scanner and printer it works fine, but the copies are very, very slow. It wasn't like this in the beginning, I have tried everything online, from reseting to factory settings, to doing the disconnect and connect steps. Nothing has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst electronic devices I have ever owned. I've used it maybe a dozen times in the two years I've owned it and half those times I had to spend an hour reading online articles and learning how to fix different problems. Today it began ripping every sheet of paper and then jamming. Have spent the last hour trying to clean it but decided it's not worth it anymore. For all the times I was able to use it vs. time spent fixing it I could have driven to Walmart and printed every time with less headache.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I've ever owned. We've had it 4 months now, and it is a struggle to print anything on it over wireless. We can only print from one of our computers, and even then it takes troubleshooting every time. Sometimes it only prints half the sheet. Sometimes you have to restart your computer and the printer before it will work. Sometimes it demands you load paper when there is already a ton of paper loaded. We have never once, in 4 months, had it print immediately after hitting "print." Unacceptable, don't waste your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: lll12345

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions and HP's customer service or should I say ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had a choice to give a lowering rating as this NOT even worth the money it was. Terrible instructions and HP's customer service or should I say lack of response is disgusting. I did buy a more expensive hp printer from bestbuy 4 years ago which stopped working and we couldn't figure it out and I needed something quick and bought this one. Trying scan multiple is a dam challenge with this printer, I have a Mac computer and downloaded the app of suites and everything but just garbage. TERRIBLE..dont waste your money use it to get a meal than on this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worst printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This printer has never been able to connect wirelessly. It also was unable to contact instant ink. I have returned it three times. Tech support has never been able to diagnose the problem so they just keep exchanging it. I can copy but no scan no print. It can not do anything at all without a USB. Save money and time I have spent so many hours on tech support for no reason and no result. Look elsewhere!!! Edit*** printer died within DAYS of the warranty and all they offered was for me to BUY ANOTHER PRINTER. Customer service was awful.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Brunson

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Much better than my old Epson Love the mobile printing feature You are able to print with only the black ink once the color ink runs out The printer is sleek and compact
customer_reviews.author: Kelsum

customer_reviews.title: multiple problems with printer losing power and having to unplug ...
customer_reviews.text: multiple problems with printer losing power and having to unplug and replug in to reboot. shortly after replacing with new HP print cartridges could not get cartridges to be recognized at all. Did all of the on line troubleshooting - still no go. online support kept saying support wasn't available after I had gone through all of the steps entering my information. impossible to find or get a hold of an HP agent on the phone to get a replacement under the one year warranty. unfortunately too late to return through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: swids

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wireless printer!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome wireless printer! After reading some of the reviews I followed the advise of a gentleman who mentioned on his review not to use the set up disk but to sign up with HP and to follow also the set up steps that comes with the printer . I was able to hooked up the printer on my MAC in less than 30 minutes. I’m so glad that I did purchase this printer, it works great:)
customer_reviews.author: Radha Ananda

customer_reviews.title: If this printer worked consistently it would be great! BUT...............
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer when it is working properly. BUT........ When I first set it up it would only print from the computer in black & white. I spent most of the day installing and uninstalling and then reinstalling over and over. I think I reinstalled everything and ran print Doctor 4 times before it finally would print in color. That was a little more than a week ago and yesterday it quit printing in color again so now I am going through the whole process again. Hoping to get it going sometime today but not sure! Already one my second cycle of uninstall, reinstall!
customer_reviews.author: S. E. W.

customer_reviews.title: One great little printer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace my previous HP OfficeJet wireless that was working, but cumbersome to use with the wi-fi. I had to "link" to it to print and during the print time I was unable to access the internet. This printer was super easy to setup, and works seamlessly with my wi-fi. I can print from anywhere in the house with my laptop or my phone. It even has the capability of an internet address so anyone can send an email to the printer and it will print it! How cool is that? Plus the printer cartridges are less expensive than the previous printer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bell

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet 3830
customer_reviews.text: Very easy wireless set up. It quickly detected my network. And is great I can now print from my Iphone. This is the second HP printer/scanner I own, but for this one, I am very disappointed the scanning software does not include OCR, therefore text in scanned documents will not be searcheable. The software for the old Photosmart I got several years ago, which was also a cheap printer, included OCR. Not that I am going to be scanning a lot of documents and/or searching text on them, but why eliminate features that were available in previous products and are not obsolete. Newer products should include even more features, not less.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Streaky printing
customer_reviews.text: Streaky printing, every couple lines of text lose their bottom or top most parts and some lines of text have lines through the entire row. I've done the alignment and set up, doesn't seem to be the cause, seems to be the printer and it's paper feed itself. Definitely can't use this for turning in reports or resumes
customer_reviews.author: cjuelich

customer_reviews.title: Worse than mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Bought the printer July 2018. Wasted too much time trying to get even basic quality prints in a consistent manner. I will get another printer or get the color version of my brother laser printer which has given no issues in 4 years. Pros It was only $40 back then so i expected at best average prints as the price was so low. If I had to buy at the current $90 price I'd be even more upset. Cons Prints very slowly Sub par print quality Streaked printing and cleaning cartridges did not work
customer_reviews.author: Jamaican

customer_reviews.title: HP Printer Has Constant Error Messages and Off-Line Issues
customer_reviews.text: Less than seven months this HP printer has become an absolute night mare to utilize. For the past 30 days this printer keeps going off-line without any reason. All the devices in my home are keeping a connection to my Wifi, but his printer constantly goes off-line without warning. I have a Linksys wifi system and Dell Inspirion 17 / 7000 Seriers laptop, hence my operating devices are current to new. I've followed the steps to reconnect the printer and after one print job, the HP printer starts flashing error messages and goes back off-line. I either have a LEMON or this model never should have been released to the public.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Will stop working randomly a LOT and takes forever to figure out the problem!!!
customer_reviews.text: It keeps disconnecting randomly. When I run the troubleshooter it'll say everything is functioning correctly but its still not printing. I've spent hours "fixing" it whenever it stops working. Looks nice, when it works its great for black and white but it won't print in color even though all color settings are on. I had an HP printer prior to this one and I should have known not to get another one. Got it because it was a good deal but SO not worth it because of the hassle and time away from work its caused trying to fix the thing. NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bbams

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable, affordable, compact wireless printer with ADF
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this printer! I wanted an affordable, reliable, compact, wireless printer with an automatic document feeder, and this not only met my expectations but exceeded them. It was easy to set up and to connect to the wifi network. It's very compact, as printers go. It stays connected to the wifi (unlike other wireless printers I've dealt with), and it automatically reconnects to the network when I lose power or turn it off and back on. It prints much faster than I expected - I'd estimate maybe 3 seconds per page when I print in black and white. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for almost three months now. I was skeptical at first after reading some of the reviews. But my experience with this printer has been exceptional. Excellent print quality, speed of printing, wifi printing and the document feeder for the scanner and copies. I wasn't sure about the ink subscription, but after having so many clogged cartridges with my old printer, this has been a welcome change. No more expensive clogged cartridges to replace. Subscription price seems reasonable to me based on how many cartridges I was going through on my old printer. I have not had a clogged cartridge with this printer. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LeftSeat

customer_reviews.title: Decent Printer - here's what to do..
customer_reviews.text: Some individuals here have freaked out and probably became violent over the "instant ink" thing. It is completely false that this printer will only work with that subscription. In fact, I've used this model for YEARS with no "instant ink." It's rather simple. Hit skip on the installation sections for "instant ink." Yeah, in some parts of the installation, it asks you over and over. Just pay attention and decline. Use any #63 cartridges you like. It's not the end of the world and no, it won't print you billions of paper dollars. It's just a printer.
customer_reviews.author: COMSECFOR

customer_reviews.title: For the price, worth the buy. But... read below.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new printer but didn't want to be spending over $40 for one. Tried to get a non WiFi one bc our last WiFi printer gave us issues, but they seem hard to find these days. Connected fine to my husbands laptop, but is giving me grief getting connected to mine. Also, after a week, it stopped reading print requests from his computer and I no joke had to Install an old drive update, which created a second printer connection he has to use. It works now. But super annoying. But if it gives us two or so years out of it, ain't going to complain about the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: You can connect without internet or USB
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use this without network WiFi you use direct WiFi. The printer does not have to be connected to the internet but you need a device with WiFi to connect to the printer. I was able to do it with all my Apple phones and tablets. The printer makes its own WiFi network you login to. You have to go print the configuration page in the WiFi setup on the printer menu and the password will be displayed. It took me forever to figure it out. I’m not super tech savvy though ;)
customer_reviews.author: RenaC

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer and love it! I spent way too long reading reviews of different printers and finally decided none are perfect and to just go with a mid range one and hope for the best. Set up was very easy. Prints a liiitle slow but I don't need speed. Have printed several things now and was not required at any point to subscribe to instant ink. It technically isn't compatible with my HP Chromebook, but there is a work around by registering the printer with Google Cloud Print, which only took a couple minutes. Would recommend this printer for occasional home use, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Morem

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Can print from anywhere by sending an image to the printer via email. For example, if I need to print my boarding pass right when I check in (exactly 24 hours before my flight), I can send the print job to my house while at work. Much sleeker design than most printers of this size. Very easy to pack up and use somewhere else. Just plug in the power cord and connect to local WiFi, and you're ready to print. It is InstantInk compatible. I don't have to worry about ink. The printer lets HP know when I need replacement cartridge(s), and they get shipped to me automatically. Much quieter than my previous Epson printer of similar price.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: Great printer in the beginning and loved that it could copy. About 2 months ago, it randomly stopped connecting to our computer and now won't print color....at all! Color ink is full, we even went and spent the money to buy new cartridges, printer is set to color, color is set on printer preferences....and out comes black and white. Also, we have to completely restart the printer multiple times to get it to print. Tried connecting it to a different computer, same issue. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Ward

customer_reviews.title: Ugh.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good thing I don't need to use this on a regular basis. At least 50% of the time there's a problem printing. If I have several jobs in the queue at one time, it prints a few and then just stops and I have to wait for however much time - I can never guess how long it will be - until it decides to work again. I'll turn it off for a while and sometimes it goes right to work and other times, nothing. Then I just get aggravated and turn it off overnight. Seriously - overnight? I guess it gets so tired that it needs a nap. First HP product, LAST HP product.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Stone

customer_reviews.title: Loved HP products til now
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a year, connected to wireless modem and internet fine. worked well until it had to be reconnected to a new modem by wireless provider. Have two HP notebooks and 2 smart tvs which reconnected fine. Printer refused to release old modem connections and be connected to new one. Have attempted to get help from HP customer service as instructed. No follow through. Have no recourse but to buy new printer. UGH
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hate this printer.  It is not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool and a good printer is very important. This printer did not last long, barely a year. At first it worked fine. Then the problems began. It would not print color even with new ink and then it would suck up all ink. Ink is expensive. I don't want to buy it once a month! I would have to run a trouble shooter every time I went to print. Our last printer lasted for years without givin up on us. This printer is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful Experience
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer today, and after spending approximately one (1) hour trying to install because I kept getting alerts that the filter needed cleaning and to find the instructions on the manual (which I never found!) Also, an alert of having paper jam when there was no paper! I contacted support, and the guy was more interested in selling me a subscription, claiming that my lap top was "too slow" and never resolved the problems, after being on the phone for over two (2) hours. Quite frustrating. Additionally, the top tray was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: ledgerina

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer ever. So wish I had read the reviews. You set it up - I chose to connect with it a cable but it keeps saying it cannot find the printer. So you go to the help section and you have to deinstall literally everything and reinstall. So you waste a half hour doing that. Only to find you have to do that every few days. I have struggled with his printer since April. Now just going to toss it - so do not waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: User-friendly, high quality printer!
customer_reviews.text: We really love this printer! While I haven't yet used it to print photos, I am impressed with the quality of everything I have printed. It's very user-friendly, and works well with my Android phone, as well as my husband's Iphone. I really enjoy the wireless printing. Everything prints in seconds, and paper loading and ink replacement is simple. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TinkerMommy

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging?!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for $49.99. I love it, I signed up for the instant ink service and that was been wonderful as well. HOWEVER, this is now being sold for 99.99. Price gouging during a PANDEMIC? Buyer beware. I wouldn’t touch this because as much as I like it, it is NOT a $99.99 printer. Solidarity for your fellow man is needed in times like this. Drop your price back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: During setup continuous "carriage jam" message. Checked that all packaging material was removed. Went through online troubleshooting, then called HP support. 45 minutes of more troubleshooting to no avail. They offered to send replacement. At this point, I am losing confidence w/ this product and manufacturer, but I will give it a chance. Then she tells me they will send a refurbished model. What? I did not pay full price for a refurb -- I purchased a new model. I expect a new model replacement for this defective model. So goodbye, this piece of junk is going back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jac31

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I have had trouble with many printers in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have had trouble with many printers in the past. I installed the included ink cartridges and went to the link on the printer screen to "connect" it to my Mac whereupon it set it up on the wireless network without having to type in the password. I did not have to sign up the for HP program that buys new ink automatically for you. And I did not have to install the CD that was included or special drivers for my Mac. Printing works fine and the printer seems easy and effective to use so far.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my printer today and it was easy to program to my laptop and my amazon dot. i didn't have any problems programing it to my wifi either. I read the reviews and I started not to purchase, but the price was right. When I did the test print, the page was perfect. I will give another update after I have had it for a while. Oh and it didn't ask me to sign up for the monthly ink subscription. That would be a deal breaker for me. I don't print that often. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Not expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Brother all in one that worked for years. This product seems to do everything just as well, and wasn't expensive. The WiFi card has a decent range and is stable. The multi-document feeder works well. Dislike the paper feeder. Prefer paper feed drawers, but that's personal preference. The paper catch tray is not automatic like some, but it works perfectly well and keeps the price of the unit low. Good prints so far, although a little dark on the black printing. Perhaps there's a setting for that I haven't found. All in all, I give it 5 stars for a good all around all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: MarshWalker

customer_reviews.title: Agreed..not worth the small amount of money paid for it.
customer_reviews.text: This printer will not stay online. I spent 2 hours on the phone with HP only to have them tell me to call my internet provider who Guess What!!! said it was a printer issue! That was of course after another two hours on the phone with them. This is an intermittent problem losing the internet but it just keeps happening! My favorite part is that to send it back I have to Print !!! the label!!! Not a happy camper since it is offline again.... Save yourself the hassle.....don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great, lot's of features
customer_reviews.text: - I love that it can scan multiple documents in a go (meaning you just put your documents on the tray and with one click they will all be scanned). - Wifi and printing documents by sending them to the printer's email address is pretty great. - Getting started using it is pretty easy. - It would have been nice if there had been more instructions about the features offered by the printer. I had to watch youtube videos to figure some of them out.
customer_reviews.author: Francois

customer_reviews.title: FIRST TIME IN MY LIFE TO SAY... I LOVE THIS PRINTER!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I have had many, many, many printers. Really expensive print quality Epson's and they have always always always given me problems. Sometimes, well all the time, but especially if you just need some documents you just want a printer to work, push a button kind of easy. I got this thing to print from my phone, my sons phone, my husbands phone and all the relevant (up to date) computers in a half an hour. I am concerned that perhaps we should not update all our software because its one of those things that might not keep up with apples constant annoying updates but what can you do but cross your e-fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STILL waiting on a functional color cartridge.
customer_reviews.text: STILL waiting on the replacement color cartridge. The color cartridge in the box did not work. A problem with many of the printers shipped around the time mine was. I spent several phone calls with customer service confirming the cartridge did not work. It has been WEEKS and I am still waiting on the new cartridge. this will be the last HP printer I buy. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This printer disappointed me.
customer_reviews.text: It is rear loading. Uncomfortable to adjust paper guides and the plastic parts are flimsy. Do you know the correct number for different size birthday card? or the number for different business envelopes? There are 10 different envelope sizes to choose from and if you don't know your christmas card envelope nomenclature you'll just have to hand write it. Same for any other as well. This printer disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz S.

customer_reviews.title: Useless Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Cursed be that day when I purchased this nasty piece of plastic misleadingly called a printer. The permanent state “printer requires the user’s attention” every time you are trying to print something. It’s supposed to be wireless, it does not stay connected under no circumstances. It’s useless! Infuriatingly useless, and you cannot even figure out what the hell Is wrong with this garbage. It just doesn’t print and requires human attention. It’s sensitive, maybe had a bad childhood or something. I wish I could return this piece of C..P but they would make me pay for the shipping, which costs more than this cursed thing itself. Do NOY BUY it!
customer_reviews.author: angelphillips

customer_reviews.title: Lots of printing difficulties!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer continues to have problems! It just out of the blue won't print in color. The color cartridge works fine since I can copy in color. I've had to uninstall and reinstall the driver several times. It works, then it doesn't. I've had tech support remote in and 'permanently' fix it, but their interference with my computer messed up other things. Now, a month later, the printer stopped printing in color, AGAIN!!!! This is a total waste of time and resources. It also sucks at printing envelopes. I have to stand at the printer and assist the feed or else it cuts off the beginning of the envelope and half the return address is missing.
customer_reviews.author: DCRED

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jam After Every Print Job But Not Really
customer_reviews.text: There are many elements of modern technology that have escaped adequate levels of usability despite the assumption that Newer Is Better. My printer of 20 years ago functioned better than the last 10 printers I've been forced to "upgrade" in years since. The printer in this review does on occasion print documents and make copies. What it also does best is produce non-existent paper jams. I find that the same old technique that has always worked in the history of all things computer is to restart the machine (unplug in this case). This mystifies me. Also, don't install the instant ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Lamp

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: From the very start it was printing only one page at a time. And the quality was mediocre. Even if you wanted to print one page at a time you will need to restart the printer after each printed page, I mean completely disconnect the power, wait a bit, redo everything again. Well, at least it was printing something. Then, after a few months, it started printing (still one page) a very pale page even after cleaning the ink heads several times. The ink indicator still shows some ink is remaining there. I tried to switch to just black and white - the same result. It is a total waste of money. Never again will buy HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: ErikT

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing printer and customer support
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is OK at best, but after 2 months it started displaying a paper-jam message that wouldn't go away. After hours of checking the printer for paper jams and being on the phone with customer service, they sent me a refurbished printer which had even worse problems. Even when the printer was working there were constant little problems like disconnecting from the network, not being able to identify my router, duplicating print jobs even though I only sent it to the printer once, and constant freezing of the touch screen. Very much not recommended. This has been a complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Music Thief

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: After my Canon printer finally failed after several years, I decided to buy this HP because it was cheap. However, this unit only lasted 11 months and then it stopped printing. There was no warning stating that the ink might be low; in fact, it stated that the black and the colored ink tanks had 25% left in each of them. I tried cleaning and aligning the printheads but that didn’t help. I thought about buying new ink tanks just to try but HP wanted almost as much for them as I paid for the printer originally. I decided to switch back to a Canon printer because I have always had good luck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Can only print with this all in one.  Can scan but can't do anything with the scan.
customer_reviews.text: I gave two stars because it arrived on time and I can print from my laptop. There was no CD for installation and there was also no phone cord. After over an hour I was finally able to print a document from my laptop. I still cannot save a scan to my laptop. I can't email a scan. Useless as a scanner and as a fax. Basically all the issues I needed to resolve when I decided to buy this printer aren't resolved. My laptop is only a couple months old and is also an HP. You would think they would work together. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AnjeleJ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is only attached by WiFi. Every time I shut down my computer it disconnects and I have to try to connect it again which is a pain. We have two computers in the house so if I have my computer on and my husband has his on it will always connect to his not allowing anything to be printed from my computer. When something finally prints it is horrible quality. It always looks like there are lines going throughout the page. At first I thought it could be from the ink cartridge but it still does it when a new cartridge is installed. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Emmaleighbee

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it worked great. However
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it worked great. However, to set it up I had to call HP and it took 2 hours (mostly from being on hold). After all that work, the printer only worked for a month when it stopped working. It says "cartage jam" but there is no paper jam and we tried all of the troubleshoot tips and it still does not work. I found it to be a waste of money. But I hope others have a better experience. I personally would not recommend it. Having had other printers in the past that lasted at least a couple of years, I found this purchase pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Catt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the ad, this printer cannot Airprint nor is it HP eprint capable. According to HPs site the only mobile capable printing is Googles cloud. Even the box states its compatible with eprint and airprint. Hate false advertising. As far as a printer, it works as advertised. Wireless printing complaint - cannot have both the wired and direless driver loaded at same time on computer, still working through this issue, hope to find a way to do both. If mobile printing a requirement, do your research with vendor before relying on the ads.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer with some important caveats
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, inexpensive all in one. The print product is fine. I think it's perfect for a shared home printer. Unfortunately, I bought it for my daughter to use in the dormitory at school -- which presents some problems. This is marketed as a wireless printer, but in this environment it's both visible and usable to everyone on the network -- which is bad. That said, there's an easy solution -- using a cord. Yes, this thing can be used as a corded device. There's a square port in back and the printer is easily attached to your computer with one of these:  My daughter now reports that everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth printing & more for great value!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Love being able to print from my cell phone! Easy to get app on phone, turn on bluetooth and start printin. Some little things to try to play with (Ive yet to figure out how to print several different images/items on one page (as if a page of several 3x5 images on one page but not of same image). Also, sometimes the Bluetooth connection is dropped before I can que up the item i want to print, so i have to shut down printer then restart & quickly get my selected printing sent. Still - overall it was a great deal for this printing (plus scanning & copying) ability!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kluver

customer_reviews.title: Left me feeling Angry and Stupid
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be an awesome printer, but trying to get it "activated" just left me angry and feeling stupid. Never could make it work. Apparently, the printer itself MUST connect to Internet so you can control it with your smartphone. Why I would want to do that, since the printer is only four feet away, is a mystery. Instructions are line drawings without words and HP support is 100% automated, so essentially worthless. Good luck to you, if you order one of these. Returned to Amazon, and really glad to be rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Texan23

customer_reviews.title: It’s a cheap nightmare!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been trying to install this piece of junk for over 3 hours! I cannot get past I am not a robot. This is the MOST FRUSTRATING piece of crap I’ve ever encountered. I’m trapped in one of the circles of hell with I’m not a robot. Even the previous installation instructions for even installing the cartridges are buzzard. There are no printed words, just sloppy pictures that are impossible to decipher. Please note if you call the company you may get connected to scammers with accents who take your information and literally get into your computer. I am so angry
customer_reviews.author: elaine Garan

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until the warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: One month after the warranty expired, this printer stopped accepting new blank ink cartridges (HP brand, brand new). After a frustrating 30 mins on the phone with HP, they said flatly that it was my tough luck and that it wasn't under warranty any more, so it wasn't there problem. I have had no trouble with the several HP products that I've owned in the past, but they've just lost a customer for good. UPDATE: Eventually, HP gave me a coupon towards a new printer, though I could only use it to purchase directly from them. I got this by being aggressive in my complaints. Unfortunately, with some companies, being a pain will still get you further than comity.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Printer had constant issues and HP CHARGES you for Ink!!!
customer_reviews.text: -Would not print in color due to an update conflict with WINDOWS. HP has yet to find an easy fix for this. -Jamming issues -Connectivity issues -Cheaply made and decides to stop working if you look at it wrong. -Refuses to print because it says there are issues with the cartridge. The cartridge that came with the printer and is brand NEW! -HP CHARGES YOU FOR INK AFTER RETURNING THE BROKEN PRINTER! Need I go on? I'm not sure where the positive reviews are from because this printer is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Karibini

customer_reviews.title: Printer goes offline all the time
customer_reviews.text: The printer goes offline all the time. I have to restart the router and the printer every time and now that doesn't work either. The wireless blue light is on, the internet info is all correct in the printer and it is the same wifi as the computers and phones and the printer says offline. I tried uninstalling and installing several times, but it won't work. The ink cartridges are brand new and full. It is not even one year old. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Waste of mo way after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer in July and it worked great loved everything about it. In November it started giving me problems by not wanting to grab label paper. Then it proceeding to finally not even want to grab copy paper. So in 6 months it already stopped working. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I do not know why it states my printer is ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why it states my printer is offline and won't print. I had it print one minute and the next minute it says it is offline. I cannot figure out how to fix it. I need a person to talk to troubleshoot with me. Again I was on vacation and came back and now 30 days have gone by and I cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: UPconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Clunky, chugs ink & constant faulty errors
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked "OK" for for a couple of months, then I started receiving an error on the screen "photo tray blocked" when in fact, the tray is not blocked and can slide freely on its track. On top of this, the printer goes through ink very quickly, even using the economy option when printing, it has a feeder for scanning and copying but if you are going to use it, be ready to wait about 20 seconds per page to feed through. I get it that its a budget friendly printer, but it should at least function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Unger

customer_reviews.title: Good, economical little printer
customer_reviews.text: Completely easy to set up. If you can install an app on your smart phone and follow directions it will be no problem. 10 minutes or less. During the set up process you just have to connect to the Wi-Fi from the printer which is typical nowadays. This printer is way better than my 7 year old Canon MX439. I just opted out of the ink purchase program and simply stated I’d buy it at normal price when I need it. Doesn’t seem like auto ordering is anything I want to get involved with. I guess I’m old-school.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a pretty good printer. Instructions were not too difficult to follow setting up, and the print came out nice and clear. The problem is connecting to my router. It doesn't happen. Even going to the proper website and following all the instructions doesn't help. Using the help box doesn't help. Having a software engineer helping me doesn't help. No way can I use this printer wirelessly. Spent hours over and over again trying every way imaginable to get it to work, but will have to plug it into my PC, defeating the purpose of buying a wireless printer.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M P

customer_reviews.title: If you have free time to waste sitting by a printer...
customer_reviews.text: If you have free time to waste sitting by waiting for it to get done printing one piece of paper....this is your printer. Works fine if you dont need to print often. Its like it forgets what its doing in the middle of printing or it gets winded and need to take a break in the midst of printing. So frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Justwin

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!
customer_reviews.text: Good printer except when you want to do something crazy like loading paper. You will have to fight to get it to work without saying paper jam. Every single time you load paper plan on messing with it for at least 20 minutes pulling the paper back out and reloading it then to have a paper jam error. I have owned this printer for about 6 months. As an IT professional, I find myself buying printers all the time. More times than not, I will give my printer to that person and get a new one. If this problem persists, I will post a pic of me driving over this piece of junk in our office parking lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Morris

customer_reviews.title: So FRUSTRATED>>>
customer_reviews.text: First it quite printing any color. I ran through all the support suggestions, and nothing. Then it started telling me it had to be connected to print. It was connected. Then, after again following all the support suggestions it finally printed but only blue ink! I turned everything off after 3 hours of trying to get it to work but not going to pay $20 for a real person to talk to. I unplugged it and went to bed. This morning I started my computer, plugged the printer in . . . . NOW it won't even turn on!
customer_reviews.author: Nana DJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer. No Issues.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for years and I have never had problems with it. Printers always have connection issues, and I do have that with my phone, bus not my computer. The print quality is reliable and clear and I have yet to have any problems with paper jams or technical issues. The touch screen is really basic and the menus on it are slightly confusing, but I rarely have to use it because the desktop app is so nice. I also use the HP print program and it has been a time and money saver. I print a lot and do not pay a lot of attention to my ink.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Riis

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 78 and read the reviews (after I ordered) and several said it was difficult to set up so I was really worried..Not true, I couldn’t believe how easy it was. When I press print, it starts right away and the pages look really good. Haven’t printed any photos yet. Prints from my I pad and lap top.. really like the ink plan and am happy with the performance. My only concern is longevity, got this one because my 2 year old (different model) died....I don’t print a lot so was very unhappy with the death of the other printer in such a short time. The main reason I went with another HP is their ink plan.....it’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Randall

customer_reviews.title: Problem with returning printer.
customer_reviews.text: Ok..I ordered a new printer..doesn't fit & not what I was looking for..my Old printer (6520) would not print black...could not find this printer (probably not made anymore)..So ordered a new one...I do not have a printer..Amazon said to take to the UPS store & send back (UP store would print new label..NO UPS store near me..one probably 300 miles away! (we only have pick up return pkgs with labels).. So still trying to figure how to get a new label ...without driving 300 miles...Live in MT..so limited...Do love UPS & Amazon. Know this will work out, (I hope!)
customer_reviews.author: Diana K. Yarger

customer_reviews.title: TAKE YOUR TIME! !
customer_reviews.text: HP gives little on directions depending on visual pages to install printer. First time through, i missed a blue tape inside which caused the major delay, and then spent more time getting the ink cartridges correctly installed. No real help from the diagrams included. Started over taking my time - no more problems. Best thing, the printer works like a dream! The low price was a plus and it has worked in all capacities except FAX.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Selover

customer_reviews.title: Worked beautifully for exactly one day...
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonderfully for one day exactly. The next time I powered it on the paper began feeding into it crooked and caused a jam. After straightening it out it would then say it was out of paper. So, it would then alternate between paper jams or being "out of paper." I've trouble shooted the process for paper jams and have no idea where to go from here so I guess this is now a $45 hunk of trash. Thank goodness I'm still within the return window. Edit: I received a replacement from Amazon and will review again once I've had it for a few days or so.
customer_reviews.author: Pupperoni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer.  Entering passcode at set up stage tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Can now print from my Apple iPad and my Android cell phone. Set up was easy, but that’s because I watched a bunch of YouTube videos prior to my setting it up (which I strongly suggest) . Entering the password for my WiFi was a little trickly because they group the letters and numbers together like an old cell phone. This means, when trying to enter your password, you will see an “abcd” and a “123”, etc which means, for example, to get to the letter “c”, youhave to tap on the group quickly to get to the letter you want. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Adler

customer_reviews.title: Fast printing, with a couple disadvantages
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up. It prints very fast, which I love. but the little arm that comes out to catch the paper is so small, I tuck it away when not in use because I am afraid of walking past it, bumping it, and breaking it off. I usually forget to pull it out when I print the next time, so the paper comes out on to the floor. Also, it will not automatically print on both sides. You need to get the first side printed, then reinsert it for the second side. For the price, not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Kubala

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this printer is as expected and has been serving its purpose for me just fine! However, there are a few things I didn't realize when buying it: - This printer does NOT have automatic double-sided printing. You must manually reinsert the pages if you want to print on both sides. - This does NOT come with a USB cord to connect directly into a computer or laptop. I had to order one separately. If you have a university/dormitory wifi connection, you may have the same problem that I did where I could not use it wirelessly. In this case, you will need to purchase the cord separately.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Read all reviews before you make your choices
customer_reviews.text: Printer itself is great, easy to install, use with phone, tablet or pc is very easy, instantink as idea is great but when you need customer support service because online their virtual agent takes you for an endless ride and you need help it's a disaster! And if you need extra ink or replacement cartridge then you have to wait a week! Think twice if you to do write up for instant ink.... amazon is faster sending an extra cartridge
customer_reviews.author: petra

customer_reviews.title: Does not print predictably
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. It decides when to print, how much of the document to print, and whether or not it has lines or errors. For example, a 15 page document just took a dozen printing attempts, the top of most pages is covered in lines, and the paper jammed no less than 10 times. Some pages are crinkled. Some are fine. But hey, sometimes it prints fine. On the first try. And those attempts make me feel like a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi O

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: The wireless capabilities for this printer worked wonderfully for about 48 hours. Even by redownloading the software multiple times, I still cannot get the printer to print wirelessly- and the printer did not even come with a computer cord so you are completely left with the wireless option only. Very dissatisfied with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: HCR

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over 2 months now and only successfully been able to print a few pages because it CONSTANTLY gets a paper jam no matter what paper I am using. God forbid I tried the "print both sides" option. Since then it has been completely useless saying there is a paper jam when NONE is there. It is a useless brick and I have to take all of my printing jobs to the local UPS store now until I find something else. do NOT buy this printer. It is awful.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.K

customer_reviews.title: I have nicknamed it Satan.
customer_reviews.text: This printer makes your life harder than back when you wrote everything out in pen. It works half the time, hijacks all the WiFi to run, and then reads “offline”. We haven’t even gotten to pay for print part.. If you’re looking for a printer you want to take to target practice, Satan is your printer. Otherwise, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyAue

customer_reviews.title: Works great, instant ink is a solid value
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great for everyday printing. It was easy to install, and handles printing from our phones or laptop on the same network. Best of all, the ink is free for life, as long as you only print a few pages a month and sign up for the HP instant ink program. That's huge in my world, as we don't do much printing, but it's always a hassle when we need to and are out of ink. The HP program sends you ink before you need it. And even if you need to print more, the price on the ink is pretty good for general home printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer a very short time. It wasn't difficult to set up and get it connected and I loved the quiet mode but then it became problematic. I didn't care for how the ink cartridges load. It is difficult to locate some features/capabilities such as printing on both sides of the paper as I recently had to do. The breaking point came this morning. My autistic son woke us up very early screaming because he couldn't get his game wheels to print in color. The printer no longer prints in color, only when doing a test sheet. I'm not going to battle the thing every time I want to use it. I would not recommend this one to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: MrChiSoxTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: Great value, Reliable brand, no disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I moved into the 21st century buying this agile printer/scanner/fax machine with wireless capability. Very good paper capacity and print quality. Easy set up. And I never knew the convenience of wireless printing until now. I'm able to print Adobe and Word files through both my laptop AND smart phones...and have them waiting for my pick up. Plus I get HP update monitoring, printer cartridge support, and tech support. Overall, I rate this a wonderful buy for a home use printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Harris

customer_reviews.title: Possibly Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This printer WAS VERY HARD to set up and after getting it set up...now it's "not connected to internet" which it is. This printer will probably be boxed up and returned. DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money and frustration
customer_reviews.text: A printer that doesn't print! I've had this set up for 3 days and I've had trouble with 3 out 6 things I've tried to print! I had to download 2 apps that I feel are unnecessary instead of just printing from my device as I did with my previous printer and now it is Christmas time and I cannot print the e-gift cards I need. I have had to take out and put the ink cartridges back in twice just to get it to print. Color ink bleeds through to the next line. More trouble than it is worth, I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this printer is pretty awesome. I ditched my Epson in favor of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this printer is pretty awesome. I ditched my Epson in favor of this HP after once again inserting a black ink cartridge for the printer to stop printing text. have a MacBook Pro & an iPad & iPhone. All three are printing with ease. The setup was maybe 15 minutes long including online registration, unpacking, and calibration. It was very easy connecting to my wireless internet, and I didn't use the cd-rom provided for software drivers. I simply downloaded from HP online. I'm considering signing up for the HP ink program so I will have to post about that once I decide. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Two broken printers
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, do not buy this printer! I bought two of these printers, and, gave one to my brother, in January of 2019. Both printers are broken and we have been through the troubleshooting on both of them. The paper feeder on my printer is not working properly resulting in massive paper jams, and my brother's printer just inexplicably doesn't work. It won't print or doesn't feed paper into the printer to begin printing. So frustrating! I thought this was going to be a good printer for us, but no, both are broken.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea DeGrazia

customer_reviews.title: BIG PROBLEM. NO COLOR. VERY FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.text: The printer installed and came up on my network quickly and easily. HP color and black cartridges installed. It prints test pages and color copies alright. HOWEVER, it will NOT print color from windows or any of my apps and programs. It's seems to be stuck on monochromatic printing. It does not accept changing it to color, or often won't even show the option to do so. This is a known problem, just Google it. Per HP, I've removed and reinstalled the printer and HP drivers numerous times with no success. Come on. Ridiculous. Just read how often this is in the Amazon comments... I should have.
customer_reviews.author: h87111

customer_reviews.title: Replacement ink costs more than printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer suddenly stopped printing in color. Spent over 2 hours on the phone talking to several service reps. The ink levels were at 75% when i started. Turned out to be a problem with the sw used to print. In the meantime I had to print out 5 different documents to check if it was working right. It finally did work and then ran out of ink. HP is all about getting you to subscribe to their automatic ink refill program, since just to replace the ink costs MORE than the original price of the printer. I am very unhappy, considering throwing it away and starting over with a different brand. My advice is to avoid HP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lots of features
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to get setup on my wireless network, and now I can print from and scan to any computer on my network. There's even an email address I can send stuff to to print from off-network. Scans look good, printing looks good, and works with the HP Instant Ink service. The little touchscreen is pretty responsive and fast, and is laid out in a logical order.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Wakeling

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The paper handling isn't great. You can load maybe 50 sheets into it and the holder is crap, letting the paper lean forward or back without adequate support. The black ink ran out super quick. I've had it a year with some light form printing and I'm out. (Also, there was no warning of low ink, it just stopped printing black and all the testing says everything is fine.) Print quality is all right though. The feed system is pretty durable and effective, only one sheet at a time (which was a problem with my last printer, it'd suck a couple sheets in at a time, so I really appreciate it here). I don't recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this printer .
customer_reviews.text: The 3 days I had it it would not print any color when it did it was in a green tone . I spent at least 4 hours on the phone with tech people to it it fixed and 1 hour on line with a person who couldn't speak english ! they said send it back so I did and reordered another one which would not connect with the wifi spent another 1 1/2 they never got it to connect sent it back . It a pain when you have to send them back ,never again I went to Best By NO problem now !
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D.

product_meta.title: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Wireless Printer, HP Instant Ink, Works with Alexa (K7V40A)
product_meta.description: Style:PrinterEasy mobile printing: Start printing and get connected quickly with easy setup from your smartphone, tablet, or PC. Connect your smartphone or tablet directly to your printer?and easily print without accessing a network. Manage printing tasks and scan on the go with the free HP All-in-One Printer Remote mobile app. Affordable at-home printing: Full of value?print up to twice as many pages with Original HP high-yield ink cartridges. Get high-quality prints?time after time?with an all-in-one designed and built to be reliable. Everything you need?right away: Take charge of your tasks and finish in less time with the easy-to-use 2. 2-inch (5. 5 cm) display. Quickly copy, scan, and fax multipage documents with the 35-page automatic document feeder. Access coloring pages, recipes, coupons, and more with free HP Printables?delivered on your schedule. Designed to fit your life: Save your space with a compact all-in-one designed to fit on your desk, on a shelf, or anywhere you need it. Print in any room you choose?without causing disruptions. Optional quiet mode helps keep noise to a minimum. COMPATIBLE OPERATING SYSTEMS - Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7; OS X v10.8 Mountain Lion, OS X v10.9 Mavericks, OS X v10.10 Yosemite .
feature_bullets: Main functions of this HP color inkjet photo printer: copy, scan, fax, wireless printing, AirPrint, touchscreen, Instant Ink ready so you'll never run out of ink, and more

The power of your printer in the palm of your hand: The HP Smart app allows you to easily set up your printer, scan from your smartphone, order toner, and print from the cloud—such as iCloud, Dropbox and Google Drive

Ink delivered to your home: get your first 2 months free when you enroll in HP Instant Ink (optional) during printer set up; plans starting at $2.99 per month after the trial period, shipping and recycling included
Print laser-quality documents and lab-quality photos from your smartphone or tablet
Optional quiet mode helps keep noise to a minimum
Designed to fit your life: Save your space with a compact all-in-one designed to fit on your desk, on a shelf, or anywhere you need it
Paper sizes supported: Letter; legal; 4 x 6 in; 5 x 7 in; 8 x 10 in; No 10 envelopes
One-year limited hardware warranty; 24-hour, 7 days a week Web support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars16,831 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
